item.title: What is The LEGO Batman: Legacy of The Dark Knight Release Date? Release Window, Explained
item.content:encoded:
LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight’s reveal at Gamescom 2025 has ignited a wealth of excitement for the upcoming title from TT Games, and we’ve gathered everything we know about the release date.

Revealed as the next LEGO title from TT Games, LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight impressed us during a hands-on preview, although some eyebrows have been raised with marketing stating that there are only seven playable characters in the game.

There’s still plenty to be revealed about LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, and, if you want to begin your countdown to release, we’ve got all the details you need.

Does LEGO Batman: Legacy of The Dark Knight Have a Release Date?

No, a precise release date for LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight has not been shared by TT Games.

After being revealed at Gamescom, it’s understandable that players are keen to know exactly when they will be able to get their hands on the title, but there’s going to be a bit of a wait before those details become available.

In fact, don’t expect a precise release date to be shared this year, given the release window that has been issued is pretty broad.

What is The LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight Release Window?

TT Games announced at Gamescom, following the reveal of LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, that the release window for the title is 2026.

Unlike many other games, no specific month or season for LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight‘s launch has been shared, resulting in a pretty broad window, but there are some trends that could be followed.

For example, Grand Theft Auto 6 is looming large in 2026 with a release date in May, and most, if not all, developers will want to avoid going head-to-head against the titan, giving it is expected to be one of the biggest gaming launches of all time.

Although LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga was released in April 2022, that was an outlier in TT Games’ history, as, traditionally, releases have come in May/June or September/October/November.

In 2018, LEGO: DC Super-Villains was released in October, while in 2017, LEGO: Marvel Superheroes 2 was released in November. Going back further, LEGO Dimensions was released in September 2015, and LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham was released in November 2014.

Though that doesn’t clear the release window up exactly, it does mean that TT Games’ previous schedule suggests we won’t see LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight in the first half of 2026.

Are you excited for the release of LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight? What franchise should TT Games tackle next? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For your next read, check out all the multiplayer details for LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, and read about details on whether Black Myth: Zhong Kui is a sequel to Black Myth: Wukong.

item.title: Can You Pre-Order Hollow Knight: Silksong?
item.content:encoded:
The long wait for Hollow Knight: Silksong is rapidly approaching a conclusion after a release date for the title was finally announced after years of waiting.

Hollow Knight: Silksong releases on September 4, bringing an end to years of development, and the desire to get hands-on with the game is understandable, with our verdict being that Hollow Knight: Silksong is worth the wait.

Now, players around the world are preparing for the launch and want to know if pre-orders are available, which we’ve got all the details for here.

Is Hollow Knight: Silksong Available to Pre-Order?

No, Hollow Knight: Silksong is not currently available to pre-order or purchase on any storefront.

With the long-awaited release date of the title on the horizon, the desire to secure a copy of Hollow Knight: Silksong is understandable. However, for the time being at least, you’ll need to be patient for a little while longer for pre-order details to emerge.

None of the platforms where Hollow Knight: Silksong is currently available has pre-orders listed. However, those with an Xbox Game Pass subscription can add the title to their ‘Play Later’ section, which should pre-download the full game before release.

That will likely change as the release date of September 4 edges closer, so keep an eye out for pre-order details to emerge.

Can You Preload Hollow Knight: Silksong?

Preloading Hollow Knight: Silksong is not currently available on any platform, though this will likely change as the release date approaches.

As mentioned above, storefronts do not currently have Hollow Knight: Silksong listed and available to purchase, which means that preloading the title is also out of the question for the time being.

The closest option to preloading currently available is through the Microsoft store, which has a ‘Get Game Pass’ button beneath the title alongside a note that confirms the title is “coming soon to Game Pass.” If you already have Game Pass, clicking this option will provide details of your subscription.

Preloading Hollow Knight: Silksong in full should be an available option provided before the launch period, and, with less than two weeks until the title releases at the time of writing, it shouldn’t be a long wait.

Will Hollow Knight: Silksong live up to the hype and be a Game of the Year contender? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Hollow Knight: Silksong, check out the possible start times for the title, and learn whether a demo for Silksong is currently available.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket A4a Secluded Springs—Release Date & Start Time, Confirmed Cards List
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon TCG Pocket’s latest expansion is right around the corner, with the A4a Secluded Springs set focusing on the legendary beasts of Johto.

Though not officially revealed at the time of writing, Pokémon’s Korean account leaked the announcement video that showcased highlights from the set and shared the release date.

For all the information you need about the Pokémon TCG Pocket A4a Secluded Springs set, look no further than our guide.

Pokémon TCG Pocket A4a Secluded Springs Release Date

Pokémon TCG Pocket’s A4a Secluded Springs launches on August 28, as confirmed by the leaked video.

That means it’s time to start saving your Pack Hourglasses, if you haven’t already, to begin a ripping spree as soon as the packs become available.

The easiest way to do so is by completing Daily Quests to secure free Pack Hourglasses, but make sure to check out Themed Collections and Versus Rewards for additional ones.

Pokémon TCG Pocket A4a Secluded Springs Start Times

Although the start time has not been officially confirmed, Secluded Sprigs is expected to follow the traditional release format and will become available at 11pm PT on August 27.

The table below shows all the release times and dates worldwide.

A4a Secluded Springs Card List in Pokémon TCG Pocket

The leaked trailer has revealed a handful of cards featuring in the Pokémon TCG Pocket Secluded Springs set, including several ex cards.

Suicune, Raikou, and Entei are set to take center stage, but there are also appearances from a wide range of Pokémon that aren’t native to Johto.

The reveals are limited so far, and the only images have come from screenshots from the leaked video, but more reveals are expected once an official announcement of the set is made.

In the gallery below, you can see all the cards revealed in the leaked trailer.

What are you most excited to see in Pokémon TCG Pocket’s Secluded Springs set? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Pokémon, check out everything announced at the Pokémon World Championships 2025 Closing Ceremony, and take a look at confirmation that Mega Evolution is coming to Pokémon TCG Pocket later this year.

item.title: Marvel Rivals Developers Explain Matchmaking System After Player Criticism
item.content:encoded:
Marvel Rivals developers have lifted the lid on the matchmaking system used in the title following a wrath of criticism from players.

Earlier this month, NetEase confirmed that Marvel Rivals does not use the controversial EOMM matchmaking system and promised to explain how matchmaking works in a future video.

That video has now been shared, detailing the process of matchmaking and explaining why larger party groups of four-to-six players have been banned in higher ranks.

Marvel Rivals Matchmaking, Explained

In the video posted on X (formerly Twitter), it was explained that several factors are taken into account when queuing for matches, including team composition and your competitive score—the latter calculated by Base Points and Performance Points.

Base Points depend on the outcome of the match, your current competitive score, and the average competitive score of the enemy team. Performance Points, meanwhile, reflect how well you perform in the match, but this doesn’t just tally up stats from the game due to the variety of characters.

The longer you wait for a match, the broader the search will become. When fighting in a part, you’ll only fight against similar-sized parties.

Questions have been asked on why Rivals has not introduced role-based matchmaking to the game, and the answer is that it would result in longer queue times. Similarly, that’s why four-player and six-player teams at higher ranks have also been restricted in a recent update.

Check out the full video below.

Are you happy with the details provided on the Marvel Rivals matchmaking system? How could it be improved? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Marvel Rivals, check out details on whether Daredevil is coming in Season 4, and take a look at the full patch notes from the most recent update.

item.title: Pokémon TCG Pocket A4a Set Secluded Springs Leaks Ahead of Release
item.content:encoded:
The latest set coming to Pokémon TCG Pocket has leaked ahead of an official reveal, showing that the legendary beasts of Johto will be the main focus.

Leaks for Pokémon TCG Pocket’s new set have been rather consistent and accurate, detailing what players can expect ahead of time before an official reveal takes place.

Pokémon TCG Pocket’s A4a set, set to release next week, follows on from the Wisdom of Sea and Sky A4 set released last month and is once again focused on the second generation of Pokémon.

Suicune, Raikou, & Entei Star in Pokémon TCG Pocket A4a Set

In a leaked trailer posted on X (formerly Twitter), pack art featuring Suicune was ripped open to reveal a host of new cards, including Suicune ex, before a transition to a volcano environment where Entei ex appeared. Then, Raikou ex made an appearance.

The legendary trio will clearly be the stars of the new set, which could be the penultimate set before a big shake-up in Pokémon TCG Pocket that introduces Mega Evolution to the game.

Mega Evolutions’ arrival will mark the start of the second season in the game, potentially changing the rules and pushing the sets to ‘B’, though at this stage it’s merely speculation.

Pokémon TCG Pocket has teased a “big update” later this year, though, which aligns with suggestions it could reformat the meta and transition into the next stage.

What do you think about the latest Pokémon TCG Pocket set? Let us know your thoughts in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Pokémon, check out the reveal of Mega Victreebel, and read about everything announced at the Pokémon World Championships 2025 Closing Ceremony.

item.title: All Roblox Anime Hunters Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Anime Hunters is a fun anime game in Roblox. Here is every active and expired code for the game this month.

Anime Hunters is growing in popularity, especially with anime fans. Like so many other anime games in Roblox, the game also helps you gain an advantage by using reward codes.

Below, we’ve gathered all the active reward codes this month, and we’ll also keep track of all of the expired ones. This way, you’ll always know which ones can be used.

Every Active Roblox Anime Hunters Code & Reward (August 2025)

Below, you can find all of the active codes for August 2025.

Most codes expire over time, so make sure you use them before they do.

How to Redeem Roblox Anime Hunters Codes

To redeem codes, just follow the steps below:

  1. Launch Roblox and then the Anime Hunters game.
  2. Walk up to the NPC who’s dancing with the word “Codes” above him.
  3. Click on him to bring up the text box.
  4. Type in the code you want, and press ‘Redeem’.

If the code is still active, then you’ll receive the reward. Remember, you can only use a code once.

All Expired Roblox Anime Hunters Codes

As of August 2025, we can confirm that the codes listed below have all expired.

Sometimes, expired Roblox codes are brought back. So, it’s always worth giving them a try. Some may still work with some accounts where they were never redeemed.

Where to Find Roblox Anime Hunters Codes

While you’re here, make sure you bookmark this page if you want to always know which codes are active and which have expired. That’s because we keep it updated as and when new codes arrive.

Brand new codes tend to appear first on the game’s official Discord server. This is another great way to get codes first.

Love Anime and Roblox? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fun new discussions about the best games.

If you’re a fan of anime Roblox games, you can also check out our code guides for Steal an Anime, Mobile Legends, and Anime Card Clash.
